description: The request body must include an ID, details for at least 1 field, and a permissions object. If any of these are missing, the collection isn't created.

params.name: collection
params.doc: Updated collection details. The existing collection is replaced with this version.

description:
A collection ID, revision number, permissions, and at least 1 field must be provided within `options.collection`.
If a collection with that ID exists, and if its current `revision` number matches the one provided, it is updated.
Otherwise, the request fails.

When a collection is updated, its `_updatedDate` property is changed to the current date and its `revision` property is incremented.

> **Note:**
> After a collection is updated, it only contains the properties included in the `updateDataCollection()` call. If the existing collection has properties with values and those properties
> aren't included in the updated collection details, their values are lost.

members.name: elementType
members.doc:
Element's data type.

Supported values: `TEXT`, `NUMBER`, `DATE`, `DATETIME`, `IMAGE`, `BOOLEAN`, `DOCUMENT`, `URL`, `RICH_TEXT`, `VIDEO`, `ANY`, `ARRAY_STRING`, `ARRAY_DOCUMENT`, `AUDIO`, `TIME`, `LANGUAGE`, `RICH_CONTENT`, `MEDIA_GALLERY`, `ADDRESS`, `PAGE_LINK`, `REFERENCE`, `MULTI_REFERENCE`, `OBJECT`, `ARRAY`, `LEGACY_TIME`, `LEGACY_BOOK`, `LEGACY_EXTERNAL_URL`, `LEGACY_BROKEN_REFERENCE`, `LEGACY_IMAGE`, `LEGACY_COLOR`, `LEGACY_EXTERNAL_VIDEO`.

members.name: typeMetadata
members.doc: Metadata for complex data types. This property only exists for references, multi-references, objects, and arrays.

members.name: maxSize
members.doc:
Maximum permitted number of items in an array field. Relevant for fields that hold arrays, such as those of type `ARRAY`, `ARRAY_STRING`, or `ARRAY_DOCUMENT`.

Default: No validation

members.name: minSize
members.doc:
Minimum permitted number of items in an array field. Relevant for fields that hold arrays, such as those of type `ARRAY`, `ARRAY_STRING`, or `ARRAY_DOCUMENT`.

Default: No validation

members.name: consistentRead
members.doc:
Whether to retrieve data from the primary database instance.
This decreases performance but ensures data retrieved is up to date even immediately after an update.
Learn more about [Wix Data and eventual consistency](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-data/wix-data/eventual-consistency).

Default: `false`

members.doc: IDs of the collections to retrieve.

members.doc:
Whether the returned collection list should include referenced collections.

Default: `false`

Whether to include deleted collections.

Default: `false`

members.doc: Pagination information.

Whether to retrieve data from the primary database instance.

List of requested collections.
When `include_referenced_collections` is `true` in the request, referenced collections are included here.

members.name: fieldsPattern
members.doc: Value is calculated according to pattern, whitespaces are replaced with dash [-].

members.name: urlizedOnlyPattern
members.doc: Value is only URL encoded.

members.name: fieldsPattern
members.doc: Value is calculated according to pattern, whitespaces are replaced with dash [-].

members.name: urlizedOnlyPattern
members.doc: Value is only URL encoded.

members.name: internal
members.doc:
Indicates an internal CMS field. The CMS does not display internal fields.

Default: `false`

members.name: collectionOperations
members.doc:
Collection operations supported. The listed operations can be performed on the collection itself.
+ `UPDATE`: Allows updating the collection's structure, for example adding, updating, or deleting fields. If not included, the collection's structure can't be changed.
+ `REMOVE`: Allows deleting the entire collection. If not included, the collection can't be deleted.

members.name: dataOperations
members.doc:
Data operations the collection supports. The listed operations can be performed on data the collection contains.

Supported values: `AGGREGATE`, `BULK_INSERT`, `BULK_REMOVE`, `BULK_SAVE`, `BULK_UPDATE`, `COUNT`, `DISTINCT`, `FIND`, `GET`, `INSERT`, `INSERT_REFERENCE`, `IS_REFERENCED`, `QUERY_REFERENCED`, `REMOVE`, `REMOVE_REFERENCE`, `REPLACE_REFERENCES`, `SAVE`, `TRUNCATE`, `UPDATE`.

members.name: indexLimits
members.doc: Maximum number of indexes for the collection.

members.name: field
members.doc: field to create

members.name: dataCollectionId
members.doc: ID of data collection to update

members.name: field
members.doc: field to create

members.doc: updated data collection

members.name: collection
members.doc: Collection details.

members.name: collection
members.doc: Details of collection created.

members.name: snapshotCollections
members.doc: data collections in snapshot

members.name: snapshotId
members.doc: created snapshot ID

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date the collection was created.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Collection ID. For example, `my-first-collection`. May include a namespace.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date the collection was last updated.

members.name: capabilities
members.doc: Capabilities the collection supports.

members.name: collectionType
members.doc:
Collection type. Indicates how the collection was created and is stored.

* `NATIVE`: User-created collection.
* `WIX_APP`: [Collection](https://support.wix.com/en/article/velo-working-with-wix-app-collections-and-code#what-are-wix-app-collections) created by a Wix app, including [starter collections](https://support.wix.com/en/article/velo-working-with-wix-app-collections-and-code#what-are-wix-app-starter-collections) created when a Wix app is installed.
* `BLOCKS_APP`: Collection created by a Wix Blocks app.
* `EXTERNAL`: Collection located in externally connected storage.

members.name: defaultDisplayOrder
members.doc: Indicates how the collection's items are sorted by default when a query doesn't specify an order.

members.name: displayField
members.doc: The field whose value the CMS displays to represent the collection item when referenced in a different collection.

members.name: displayName
members.doc: Collection's display name as shown in the CMS. For example, `My First Collection`.

members.name: displayNamespace
members.doc:
UI-friendly namespace of the Wix app with which the data collection is associated, such as Stores or Bookings.
Empty for all data collections not owned by internal Wix apps.

members.name: fields
members.doc: Collection's field structure.

members.name: maxPageSize
members.doc:
Maximum number of items returned in a single query, based on the underlying storage.
Native collections have a maximum page size of 1000 for offset-based queries or 100 for cursor-based queries.
External collections' maximum page size defaults to 50, but an external provider can set any maximum value up to 1000.

members.name: ownerAppId
members.doc: ID of the app that defined this collection. For user-defined collections, this value is null.

members.name: pagingModes
members.doc: All paging modes the collection supports. In native collections, offset-based paging is supported by default.

members.name: permissions
members.doc: Levels of permission for accessing and modifying data, defined by lowest role needed to perform each action.

members.name: plugins
members.doc: All plugins the collection uses. Plugins apply additional capabilities to the collection or extend its functionality.

members.name: revision
members.doc: Collection's current revision number, which increments each time the collection is updated. For an update operation to succeed, you must pass the latest revision number.

description: A data collection determines the structure of data to be stored in a database.

members.doc: list of new fields

members.name: _id
members.doc:
Unique event ID.
Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: Event timestamp.

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
(for example, GDPR).

members.name: deletedEntityAsJson
members.doc: Entity that was deleted

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: code
members.doc:
Error code.
- `WDE0112`: Unknown error while building collection index.
- `WDE0113`: Duplicate key error while building collection index.
- `WDE0114`: Document too large while building collection index.

members.name: description
members.doc: Description of the failure.

members.name: itemId
members.doc:
ID of the data item that caused the failure.
For example, if `unique` is `true`, the ID of an item containing a duplicate value.

members.name: arraySizeRange
members.doc: Array size range permitted. Relevant for fields that hold arrays, such as those of type `ARRAY`, `ARRAY_STRING`, or `ARRAY_DOCUMENT`.

members.name: capabilities
members.doc: Capabilities the field supports.

members.name: description
members.doc: Description of the field.

members.name: displayName
members.doc: Field's display name when shown in the CMS. For example, `First Name`.

members.name: encrypted
members.doc: Indicates if field is encrypted.

members.name: immutable
members.doc:
Whether the field is immutable. An immutable field can be set once, but then cannot be updated.

Default: `false`

members.name: key
members.doc: Unique identifier for the field. For example, `firstName`.

members.name: numberRange
members.doc: Range of possible values for a numerical field.

members.name: plugins
members.doc: Additional optional plugins for the field.

members.name: readOnly
members.doc:
Whether the field is read-only. A read-only field can't be changed.

Default: `false`

members.name: required
members.doc:
Whether the field is required.

Default: `false`

members.name: stringLengthRange
members.doc: Length range permitted for a text field. Relevant for fields that hold strings, such as those of type `TEXT` or `RICH_TEXT`.

members.name: systemField
members.doc: Whether the field is a system field (created automatically).

members.name: type
members.doc:
Field's data type.

Supported values: `TEXT`, `NUMBER`, `DATE`, `DATETIME`, `IMAGE`, `BOOLEAN`, `DOCUMENT`, `URL`, `RICH_TEXT`, `VIDEO`, `ANY`, `ARRAY_STRING`, `ARRAY_DOCUMENT`, `AUDIO`, `TIME`, `LANGUAGE`, `RICH_CONTENT`, `MEDIA_GALLERY`, `ADDRESS`, `PAGE_LINK`, `REFERENCE`, `MULTI_REFERENCE`, `OBJECT`, `ARRAY`, `LEGACY_TIME`, `LEGACY_BOOK`, `LEGACY_EXTERNAL_URL`, `LEGACY_BROKEN_REFERENCE`, `LEGACY_IMAGE`, `LEGACY_COLOR`, `LEGACY_EXTERNAL_VIDEO`.

members.name: typeMetadata
members.doc: Metadata for complex data types. This property only exists for references, multi-references, objects, and arrays.

members.name: queryOperators
members.doc:
Query operators that can be used for this field.

Supported values: `EQ`, `LT`, `GT`, `NE`, `LTE`, `GTE`, `STARTS_WITH`, `ENDS_WITH`, `CONTAINS`, `HAS_SOME`, `HAS_ALL`, `EXISTS`, `URLIZED`.

members.name: sortable
members.doc:
Whether the collection can be sorted by this field.

Default: `false`

members.name: cmsOptions
members.doc: Options for the CMS plugin.

members.name: type
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'CMS'`
- `'UNKNOWN'`

members.doc: Range of possible values for a numerical field.

members.name: stringLengthRange
members.doc: Length range permitted for a text field. Relevant for fields that hold strings, such as those of type `TEXT` or `RICH_TEXT`.

members.doc: current state of the field

Whether to retrieve data from the primary database instance.
This decreases performance but ensures data retrieved is up to date even immediately after an update.
Learn more about [Wix Data and eventual consistency](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-data/wix-data/eventual-consistency).

This decreases performance but ensures data retrieved is up to date even immediately after an update.

Details of collections referenced by the collection requested.
Only populated when `includeReferencedCollections` is `true` in the request.

members.name: caseInsensitive
members.doc:
Whether the index ignores case.

Default: `false`

members.name: failure
members.doc: Contains details about the reasons for failure when `status` is `FAILED`.

members.name: fields
members.doc:
Fields for which the index is defined.

Max: 3 fields (for a unique index: 1 field)

members.name: name
members.doc: Name of the index.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Current status of the index.
- `BUILDING`: Index creation is in progress.
- `ACTIVE`: Index has been successfully created and can be used in queries.
- `DROPPING`: Index is in the process of being dropped.
- `DROPPED`: Index has been dropped successfully.
- `FAILED`: Index creation has failed.
- `INVALID`: Index contains incorrectly indexed data.

members.name: unique
members.doc:
Whether the index enforces uniqueness of values in the field for which it is defined.
If `true`, the index can have only one field.

Default: `false`

description: An index is a map of a collection's data, organized according to specific fields to increase query speed.

members.name: order
members.doc:
Sort order for the index. Base on how the data is regularly queried.

Default: `ASC`

members.name: path
members.doc: Path of the field to index. For example: `title` or `options.price`.

members.name: regular
members.doc: Maximum number of regular (non-unique) indexes allowed for this collection.

members.name: total
members.doc: Maximum number of regular and unique indexes allowed for this collection.

members.name: unique
members.doc: Maximum number of unique indexes allowed for this collection.

members.name: consistentRead
members.doc:
Whether to retrieve data from the primary database instance.
This decreases performance but ensures data retrieved is up to date even immediately after an update.
Learn more about [Wix Data and eventual consistency](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-data/wix-data/eventual-consistency).

Default: `false`

members.doc:
Defines how collections in the response are sorted.

Default: Ordered by ID in ascending order.

Whether to retrieve data from the primary database instance.
This decreases performance but ensures data retrieved is up to date even immediately after an update.

members.name: singleItemOptions

members.name: type
members.doc:
Plugin types. The following plugins are supported:

* `PUBLISH`: Allows items to be marked as either draft or published. For each item you can set a publishing time when the item will become visible to site visitors.
* `SINGLE_ITEM`: Ensures the collection can have one item at most. Can only be applied to a new collection.
* `URLIZED`: Generates item URLs for collections used by dynamic pages.
* `GRIDAPPLESS`: This plugin is read-only and can't be manually added. Indicates the collection structure is shared between sandbox and live environments.
* `MULTILINGUAL`: Indicates that the collection is translatable. This allows you to manage translation for selected fields using [Wix Multilingual](https://www.wix.com/app-market/wix-multilingual).
* `CMS`: Contains CMS-related collection attributes

members.name: urlizedOptions
members.doc: Options for the Urlized plugin.

members.name: siteSort

members.name: format
members.doc:
Encoding method for generating a URL in ASCII characters.

* `ORIGINAL`: Letters are converted to lower case and spaces are replaced with dashes before generating the encoded URL.
* `PLAIN`: No changes are made before generating the encoded URL.
